“Lord Shiva is a most powerful God amongst the trinity who has given a strong message of sustainability of environment long ago. The ashes on the body is cemetery ash which points to the philosophy of life and death and shows that death is the ultimate reality of life…”

The rest of the abstract delves on the mythological aspects surrounding Shiva and metaphysical description of various attributes of Shiva as alluded to in mythology and religion.

The last paragraph of the published abstract concludes saying: “Thus we can say that ancient Indians were very much aware about the ecology and sustainability. It helps in solving specific environmental problems and the modern principles of sustainability were adopted at that time. Unfortunately, we have forgotten those golden principles laid by them. Therefore the objectives of the article are to create the awareness about the conservation of environment without causing harm to others.”
title: Extracts from published abstract on Lord Shiva
